title: So kind and helpful
body: Needed treatment for cystitis . The receptionist and nurses that I saw were great. I was seen almost immediately and given medication. Thank you all.

title: Excellent practice
body: Received both vaccinations at Market Harborough Medical Centre, very efficient on each occasion, professional and friendly too.

title: Great service!
body:
I would like to thank all of the maternity staff that supported me during my pregnancy, c-section and after. I had both of my children here, 1st one was in 2015 and 2nd in June 2021. I can only praise the excellent service by amazing obstetricians/gynaecologists, midwives, nurses and overall everyone at anti-natal, and post-natal departments. The support I’ve received is amazing and I would highly recommend Royal London hospital for maternity services. They were very kind and supportive to me and my partner during all stages. 

Thanks again and keep up the good work everyone.

title: Great care
body:
I attended an orthopaedic appointment at the out patient’s department in may. 
The department was very well organised, all the staff I came into contact with were helpful, approachable and professional 
The consultant and his team listened to my symptoms, discussed a plan of action with me and organised investigations. 
Totally impressed from beginning to end.
The past 18 months have been very difficult in the NHS, but they are all still there working so hard delivering excellent service to the public. 
We need to respect and value them more than ever. 
Keep up the great work!!

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: First Class Treatment
body: I attended the Breast Clinic on the 2nd of July 2021 for a routine Mammogram Screening. From checking in at the appointments desk, right through to the screening procedure I was made to feel at ease. The staff could not have been better, once again I applaud the GWH staff they are all worth their weight in gold and do an amazing job. Thank You !!!

readBy.name: Great Western Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor experience
body: My relative had already spent 5 weeks on another ward with multiple fractures followed by pneumonia. I has only just been allowed to visit him bc of long stay in hospital. He was transferred to the Stroke unit after 7.30 pm. I was aware that a referral had been made but no one advised me that it had happened. I visited as  usual and was re-directed where a staff member told me that there was no visiting at all on this 'new ward'. My relative was just more confused and placed in a side room. He is very hard of hearing, cannot use a phone properly and thought i had abandoned him!. Since transfer, its not clear to me what plans or treatment are likely or when even though i am able to speak with him upon request. Today he was more upset and wanted me to bring him home. I asked a member of staff and found that my relative had moved back to a side room  again. My relative could not understand why and was distressed. I do understand especially in a unit such as would not make arrangements for restricted visiting. In my relative's case it makes them more muddled and disorientated etc with none of the normal trappings of his life like family, visitors etc. i find inhuman and promoting institutionalisation. So very disappointed and upset.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Dreadful
body: Such a poor service yet one doctor is great but I cannot get to see him. I am not surprised at the letter I received last Saturday. Cannot get through despite ringing hundreds of times, no Doctors on site, no-one to help me and my son when we need help. So had to go to A and E. Self prescribed anti biotics and was given them with no phone call as to why. Rude staff on reception too. I despair. I don't know what to do.

author: Space10
title: ADHD Diagnosis
body:
About a month ago I contact my local surgery about potentially looking into ADHD. I received a self assessment form which I then returned to the practice around a week later. I have now had a call back from the GP essentially saying that even though I had submitted the form, the NHS wouldn't do anything like offering a diagnosis/assessment as they are more focused on other areas of mental health such as psychosis, suicidal thoughts etc, and that I could either potentially pay to go private and get a diagnosis and then receive NHS assistance or otherwise, just to get on with it.  
I understand that these areas will take priority, as they can be much more concerning and quickly changing. However, the process of filling out the assessment and then receiving the phonecall just to be told that they can't offer any assistance at all seems like a waste of time and has just left me feeling more stressed than before I had enquired. In short, the whole process has just made me feel like I have been palmed off and to get on with it myself, and just seems pointless.

author: Naomi D
title: Stay in hospital
body:
I have just come out of a stay in Lincoln hospital.  
Firstly, what I will say is that the staff in all the wards I went to, no matter what level, were lovely. They work so hard and the pressure on them is ridiculous, yet they still do it with a smile on their face.  
I first went into the Urgent Treatment Centre and, although it was very busy, I got seen pretty quickly. I was advised they needed to speak to the surgical team as I may need to be admitted. As it’s something I’ve been dealing with for a while, it was what I was expecting.  
However, due to how many people were in the hospital at the time, I ended up waiting from 7pm and finally got onto the ward at 11.55 the next day. This was nobody’s fault, it was just how busy they are. The team on UTC were so caring that they ended up making me a bed up in one of their treatment rooms as I was really struggling.  
Once I got onto SEAU, they worked hard to make sure all the new patients were assessed whilst still dealing with patients already in their care. All of the staff were lovely, helpful and just really looked after you.  
All the staff I came across in both departments are a credit to the hospital.  
The only downside for me (aside from the long wait) is the desk at UTC. It really does need to be more private. I could hear what people were coming in with, staff being disciplined and their conversations (not complaining about that), but surely they should have some privacy.

author: Virkie
title: Felt fobbed off
body: Ear, face, jaw, neck and shoulder pain and swelling. Referred to physio. Fobbed off with very strong potentially addictive painkillers and offered a follow-up appointment by video call!

author: cygnuspm75
title: My father's experience in A&E
body: My dad's experience in A& E has been ok. The communication hasn't always been good between us and the staff but also between his previous stays and now. The hospital is very clean and there is good privacy when you're not in the main waiting room. I am quite wary of the Covid risk while in hospital with my dad. Apart from this there hasn't been anything else overly negative.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: pigofhappiness66
title: Keeping patients in the loop
body: Firstly, I must say that the hospital is beautiful, clean and the staff on the ground are incredible. My issue is with the procedure waiting time and keeping patients in the loop. I found this intolerable. I have spent the last two years sleeping in a chair because of reflux. I waited over a year to be seen and have a bravo fitted under sedation. This was unsuccessful so I was put on the list to have the procedure under a general anaesthetic. I called almost every week, desperate for the procedure and was told each time by the head nurse that as soon as the list became available, I would be put on it. I had a missed call on Monday so I called on Tuesday I was so excited to finally get an appointment, and see the light at the end of the tunnel finally. What I was told was that I hadn't been put on the list and would have to wait until August to see if I was put on then. I couldn't believe my ears. It felt so cruel and unnecessary that I hung up and burst into tears. I have depression and PTSD, and it triggered me. The thought of having to suffer indefinitely was almost too much to cope with. I can't stop crying. I feel betrayed and mislead. It's unacceptable to treat people this way.

author: delphinusdb97
title: Language in pregnancy
body:
One of my friends who is thirty years old had her twelve week scan recently at St Thomas’ Hospital. She was advised by the sonographer about the “risks” of having a baby with a chromosomal difference due to her age.  
Parents and carers with a family member with Down’s syndrome and other chromosomal differences (including myself) have worked and campaigned hard to change the language and I was really surprised that this language was being used in a renowned and leading teaching hospital such as St Thomas’.  
Down Syndrome Research Foundation UK have free resources available on their website about language awareness. Please have a look at them and it would be wonderful if you could attach the poster in relevant areas of the hospital in order to educate your staff as well as all those involved in the care of people with any of these disabilities.  
Thank you

author: deniriley
title: Endoscopy service
body: The nursing staff were all very friendly but I was left waiting to see the doctor for 2 hours. the nurses tried to offer reassurance but I felt very isolated in my small windowless room.

author: jazzrz68
title: Rushed to Wexham hospital
body:
After falling ill towards the end of June 2021 and making a 999 slot I had to be driven by my husband to Wexham hospital. On entering A & E reception I was confronted by what I felt to be an over exuberant and familiar staff Nurse to be told that we would have to wait 6 hours, which was unacceptable as I had temperature over 37 and blood pressure about 200/100 and had not passed water for over 10 hours.  
Considering that I already had one visit by the ambulance at home, it was fairly obvious that I needed to be attended to immediately. Thankfully through my husbands' insistence a member of medical team sorted me immediately. Thereafter I was in very good hands.  
The major problem was when I was transferred to ward 4, where communication between staff members was very poor and abrupt , the noise at night was unbearable considering that patients need to rest to recover.  
After my results came through and medication was changed , I was discharged at 11 am. I was told to wait for my new medication. At 5 pm my medication was handed to me in a pharmacy bag and my husband picked me up. I was horrified to find that my medication was the boxes from my bedside cabinet.  
Why did I need to wait 6 hours?

author: lacertate36
title: re order of sanitary products
body: I have been trying to reorder some sanitary products and continence products for my wife through Ontex and the number I call is just a recorded message and I cant get to speak to anyone, there is also no provision to leave a message, its very frustrating and my wife is running out. I will speak to the community nurses about this but would appreciate this being looked into.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Em1969
title: Sons surgery
body: I have been ringing and ringing and nothing, so this is next thing, my son saw a urologist last October, and he needs 2 different surgeries, he’s 20 and in so much pain and uncomfortable, he hasn’t been able to work since last August, and is now affecting his mental Health, still waiting ……….. concerned parent 😢😢

author: seapebble
title: Given too much information
body:
Staff have been really nice and lovely. Nurse Jay was lovely. The ward is quiet and clean.  
I was given too much information and explanations are more technical and hard to understand. I'm still not too sure what is actually wrong with me.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Leo 1
title: Visit as moved back to scotland to retire
body:
I had a consultation today it was very upsetting  
The consultant did not have my records .  
Did not have a clue about me or my surgery .  
They asked me a question and their answer was you people come here with no information.  
Well if they had my notes they would have had all the answers.  
I had more questions as my last surgeon asked me to make sure i had them dealt with but felt so intimidated i didnt ask.  
My consultant in sussex was helpful. Always was there for reassurance .  
I am so upset my mask fell on the floor so i put a clean one on and got told off for not putting it on the right way . I was a nervous wreck before i left the room .  
Skin cancer or any illness is always a worry and should a patient be made to feel like this no.  
I will call cqc if this is not dealt with.  
Never in all my life have i been made to feel like this. I do not want that Dr to have anything to do with my patient care.

readBy.name: MASScot- Melanoma Action and Support Scotland

author: capellajg77
title: Left in the lobby on a stretcher
body:
Left my 66 year old dad in the lobby on a stretcher for a full day, with no painkillers and a fractured lumbar spine. And gave him nothing to eat or drink all day.  
I'm disgusted

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Dalyyah
title: My emergency department visit
body:
I attended Craigavon area hospital on Thursday with serious pelvic pain and after waiting for 10 and half hours I went home but wasn't given any information on what to do if the pain returns as pain killers weren't working. The pain was that bad today I had to ring an ambulance to take me back to hospital as the pain was indescribable.  
The ambulance staff were lovely and the ED staff but everything has been a slow response. I was told I needed urine samples and not to drink or go to the bathroom until they were done, but I felt physically sick needing to use the rest rooms. I asked numerous staff nurses and a student nurse to give me a sample pot or show me where the toilet was to no avail, until the two care opinion students came and sorted me out.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Mcdow
title: 6 weeks in 1 south
body: During my 6 weeks the staff have been great and the hospital environment. My only concern is the lack of emphasis on staff collecting my urine bottle samples as I'm on fluid restriction and my outputs are to be monitored closely. I've noticed them lying round my bed and not collected promptly.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shaaaron
title: Understaffed but staff brilliant
body: The staff at my stay in one south have been absolutely brilliant. I also have a developed a great rapport with my clinician. At the start I came into hospital on a very uncomfortable hard bed with no remote and the staff immediately sorted this and made me more comfortable. They have also  been accommodating in helping me learn to use new walking aids. I do however feel that there should be more nursing staff around at times, at one stage I really needed to toilet but noone was around so I tried to walk myself but had a fall.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Saturday03
title: Problems which could have easily been fixed
body:
This is my second time back on 2 West since I gave birth last week. After having a major operation C-section and a blood transfusion I was not feeling myself and was rather tired and sore. I found it challenging to even move from bed to chair so taking a shower seemed like a massive task too soon.  
The midwife insisted even though I was struggling to walk which I wasn't happy about. I was then left in shower room feeling faint after my shower and the midwife who was with me had left at this stage, I waited until the ward sister then found me to help me back to bed.  
I felt at times one midwife in particular was cheeky to me and didn't need to be I told the sister in charge and she apologised to me for this. When I was first on 2 West my buzzer did not work as it took 4 presses of the button to register and when the midwife came to me she said I was pressing on the buzzer as if my baby had fallen out of the cot and I needed urgent attention, however it was merely because my buzzer did not function properly.  
The second time I was back on 2 West again I was placed into a room where the buzzer again does not work so I am disappointed this is the case 2 weeks later still. I felt left in such a state after this and after just giving birth it was difficult and I couldn't even speak to my own mother on the phone as I just didn't feel up for it. My mother rang the ward to complain and she also felt like the midwife on the phone was cheeky to her too. I felt insulted. I was in agony and they didn't understand. They were rather ignorant to problems which could have been easily fixed. I feel after voicing to the head midwife nothing improved.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Atrial Patient
title: A&E ambulance Admission
body:
Admitted to whiston hospital Via Ambulance service. Had to wait 2 hrs for an ambulance, First response was at my home within minutes of coming off the phone, they stayed until an ambulance came, I am newly diagnosed with atrial fibrillation so usually need to be taken I to hospital to be monitored.  
I was taken in after 21. 00 hrs and had to be queued in a system in the corridors. The nursing staff was amazing and attentive, I was moved into resus shortly after 02. 30 exhausted and hoping I'd be seen by a Dr, 06. 00 and I asked if there was any likelihood of seeing a Dr and the nurse checked and said it would be another 3/4 hrs!  
I decided to discharge myself as I was so tired, we'd been given one cup of juice and the hub was chaotic, couldn't rest and just couldn't wait another 4 hrs. The staff were amazing and ran that shift so well we couldn't have been in more capable hands just unfortunate that there was no Dr's to see to patients, I have no confidence in the hospital as I've seen waiting times get progressively worse.

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Nurse
body: Not amused atall with how i was made to feel i know covid 19 is still around and they have to be cautious with everything but not everything is covid related yes my son had a very high temperature but due to his tonsils as no other symptoms of covid atall and was told to get him him tested. Have come away feeling very angry and made out to feel stupid. Was also told dont know why 111 send children there as they dont have a child doctor? So why is it a community hospital that anyone can been seen. Sorry but wont be useing this hospital ever again

title: Poor service
body: Nurse who did my blood pressure and pulse not friendly and didn’t even smile met alone anything else. When asking me to go to the waiting area to see a GP she said “go there”. I was then seen by a GP who I felt did not listen nor care about what I was saying or how I was feeling. She told me they didn’t do blood tests @ A&E for chronic conditions, only for acute. My condition was not chronic. Wasn’t interested or helpful in any way. Came across as very patronising too. Left tearful and felt worse than when I walked in.

title: Never got a call back in 30 hours before leaving…
body: Went online and resulted in a call back within 12 hours, 15 hours later and still nothing, was then told I would get a call back within 6 hours, I waited 6 hours, still nothing. I called again and was told it would be an hour.....still nothing. On my 4th call I was told it would hopefully be that evening, it didn't happen. So it's now almost 30 hours. I've had a nasty insect bite which has caused Cellulitis. If this is un- treated it can be deadly. I've had a temp and been in horrible pain and discomfort. Have never had any issues with 111 before but thisis just totally unacceptable.

title: Unable to contact via the phone
body:
Very poor communication staff rude front door locked have to speak via door monitoring so half the road can hear GP'S hiding behind Covid 
If you get through 2 mins max on the phone rubbish they need to see patients Massive Accident going to happen CQC need to go back in again and sort this practice out or something is yet again going to go wrong

title: Admin Problems
body: No problem with the medical staff or reception who do an excellent job but the department that does referral or uploads reports is not working properly and as a result you have to keep calling reception more times than necessary and end up blocking their time so feel very guilty. It has always been an excellent surgery in the past and I hope it will be able to address this issue going forward.

title: Waiting Time
body: My partner is 2 weeks post open heart surgery (which was performed at Castle Hill).  He was sent from Louth out of hours doctors with a suspected blood clot in his right arm possibly caused by the angiogram.  He signed in just before 10pm and I’m sat in the car still waiting 5.00am.   He has had someone take his blood and when I asked politely 30 minutes ago how much longer I was told there were 3 others in front of him and the receptionist said she didn’t know how long they would be even though I explained his circumstances .  Surely this is not good practice

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: Feel completely looked after
body: Just been recently diagnosed with diabetes and all the people who I’ve been in contact with during this time have been fantastic. I feel completely confident in their ability to get me well and to do the best for me.

title: Unbelievably rude & no empathy
body:
Totally dreadful service. Took forever to get through on the phone.
Spoken to in a very rude manner, no answer given to my only question. I asked to speak with practice manager.. phone was immediately hung up.

I've tried to leave a full review four times now & it's been rejected everytime. It appears we are not allowed to actually point out where the problem actually is. I have read the other reviews on here and therefore made sure mine doesn't contravene any of the posting rules. The post rejection process is totally immune to any questioning and is at the mercy of a subjective opinion only.

author: Charlie31
title: Help with female health issues
body:
Firstly, I need to mention that I’m a foreigner who just recently moved to Scotland. When I started experiencing health issues a week ago, it had proven difficult to get medical help straight away.  
I contacted drop-in Sexual Health Clinic, which due to pandemic is no longer a drop-in, I wasn’t able to get an appointment because I wasn’t yet registered with GP.  
Finding a GP office that would take new patients wasn’t easy. Eventually, I got one, rushed there to fill out enrollment form. However, when I asked when would I be able to see a doctor/nurse regarding my problem- I was told to wait until I’m actually registered in the system and can send an online request. I felt uncomfortable saying out loud in front of other people waiting at the reception area, that I’m bleeding like hell for 3 weeks, having abdominal pain and becoming seriously scared, so I just left.  
I tried calling 111, gave up after 27 minutes of waiting on the line with no answer.  
Yesterday, when I was absolutely panicking, because I felt that I really needed to see a doctor, I reached out to my GP office and was told the earliest they could speak to me is Monday next week.  
Eventually, I reached out to Sexual Health Clinic again and they promised the nurse would call.  
Susan got in touch very quickly, listened to my case, agreed that bleeding heavily for 3 weeks isn’t any good, and thank God for her understanding, as she agreed to see me later that day. I had tears of joy, as finally I was getting help.  
Everything ran smooth during the appointment, she did all the checks, answered dozens of my questions and reassured me when I had concerns, advised me on the way forward, and I left with the medication that is already helping to treat my issue. I can not express how grateful I am to this lady. If it wasn’t for her and the help she provided, I would still be bleeding abnormally and feeling helpless. We need more people like Susan in the system, so nobody gets to struggle and feel neglected.

title: Terrible service
body: Have been trying to get a face to face doctors appointment after months of telephone appointments. Have to ring at least 30 times on the morning to get same day appointment to be told no appointments. Poor patient care and service.

title: Fabulous Team
body: Always friendly and helpful from reception to doctors and nurses. Well done crew, you are amazing. NB you have to call in for your results; it's standard practice. 😊

title: Brilliant Practice
body: I have been a patient at this practice for a long time and I can never fault them. They have delivered the best care they can under the current circumstances. Ithe e consult service is so easy to use and I've never had a problem getting through on the phone, sometimes you have to wait a little longer, but this is expected. The telephone triage service is excellent and allows them to assess the need to visit the surgery which is brilliant for a busy mum. If there is a need to visit then I have never had a problem getting the right appointment and they have always been accommodating around my work commitments. All the nurses, doctors and reception team do a great job. Keep up the good work all of you!

title: Great practice
body:
Helpful, clean and professional staff quickly seen by nurse who listened very attentive to my issues and took quick actions in dealing with my concerns. Also noticed lack of previous blood tests, which she quickly resolved and booked all 
appointments for me. Just took all the worry I was experiencing away.

title: BRILLIANT SERVICE
body:
My wife was admitted to ward 23on the10/07/2021 after a very quick and thorough assesment in A&E.
The care she received in ward 23 was outstanding,and very proffesional.She was released on 11/07/2021 with a thorough back up package.Our thanks to all who looked after her from entering A&E to discharge from ward 23

readBy.name: Wirral University Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Needs to be improved
body:
I rang to get a prescription for my antidepressant the lady was so rude and said you could of put it in the letter box 
1 my sons year at school got shut down so we are isolating so I couldn’t just put it in the letter box 
2 was no need to be so rude to someone 
3 a few weeks back it took me 2 weeks to even get hold of the doctors to get new tablets and I have mental health illness they didn’t even seem to care one little bit rude and nasty 
Something needs to be done and 
Manners don’t cost a thing think they should go on course how to speak to treat people

title: Never phoned back
body: We phoned 111 because our 2 week old baby was screaming the 111 person I spoke to went through the usual medical questions and said someone will phone you back within 1hr. They never phoned back despite me sitting up all night and this morning waiting for the call. Obviously not nice when your baby is suffering busy or not when a newborn is involved and they still dont call back it’s a real worry that this service is not up to standard.

title: caring practice
body: every member of staff cares about you personalty. However busy they are they take time to relate to your needs and problems and always very polite. thjis is very reassuring.

title: Excellent service from Fell Cottage
body:
On Tuesday 25th May I contacted the surgery to say my father was unwell and I felt he needed assessing urgently. I was reassured by a receptionist that she would pass the message on, but also that she would call me back and let me know what was happening. I was called back within 30 minutes to let me know the oncall GP would be in touch and she was. All three of these calls took place within one our. I know the pressures primary care is under and how busy things are, so this level of service was really commendable.

The receptionists manner was pleasant and reassuring and she went above and beyond to get me in touch with a GP and sort out my problem. Many, many thanks.

I was then phoned by the GP who listened carefully to my concerns and offered to see my dad in the surgery straight away. She then did a thorough assessment and arranged for him to be seen in the hospital immediately. I think her prompt actions probably saved his life as he was in heart failure with a critical (not previously diagnosed) aortic stenosis. He tells me how lovely your manner was and how well you listened to him - so thank you for that too.
I have a friend who works at the QE who told me later 'it took the hospital 27 hours and several tests to come to the same conclusion the GP had written in her letter.' which says a lot for your clinical and diagnosis skills.

Dad is now in the Freeman and feeling much better, but waiting for an aortic valve replacement, so has to stay there until its done. 

Many thanks to you both and your colleagues for all of your hard work, but particularly in this case.

title: useless
body: never  try to  ring  waist time   and when  confronted  sorry  all  appoinments  taken  phone  always  ingaged   not  polite walkd  in  asked  why  phone engaged  all  time   when  i even  had  phone  in  my  hand rining it  it  said  same thing  reception  wasnt even  on  phone

title: Tick box exercise
body: I had a telephone consultation with the bowel specialist and felt it was a tick box exercise. You’re not seen as a person, not listened to and not heard. Don’t feel any of my questions were answered and was just spoken to in that false reassuring voice they seem to think helps. I’m not sure how adding more laxatives qualifies you as a specialist- you can get that advice at Boots, although they would even tell you not to take that many as they would recommend the detriment it does to your health and lifestyle. It would be nice to treat the problem for a change, rather than throw cheap medication at the cause. I just feel it’s causing more issues.

title: Frustrating System
body: Tried to get an appointment to see or speak to a GP for past 7 days. I have had a letter from the surgery to book an appointment but when phoning have been cut off in middle of queue and sometimes right at the end. It’s a terrible system and doesn’t benefit the patients at all. When I have finally been able to speak to someone there are no appointments left for that day. I’m not the only one to have this problem with St Marks. Does anyone ever get an appointment using this system?? I finally got a telephone appointment sometime during the day. She added that it may well be cancelled.

title: Shocking service
body: I have been with greystoke for many years and believe they have some of the best G.P's in the area who show genuine concern and compassion. This cannot be said about the receptionists. I rang this morning after been advised by 111 to contact my GP for an urgent appointment. I tried to call a few times with no answer, finally at 9.10am I got through. I asked for a telephone appointment with a doctor and was told sorry we are at full capacity and I need to ring before 8.30am. I was not asked is it urgent or why I was ringing etc, also the fact I was ringing before 8.30am but couldn't get an answer. I feel so let down and wonder how many medical emergencies are being missed due to rude receptionists who clearly lack basic key skills.

title: CANNOT PRAISE ENOUGH
body: I speak on behalf of a very elderly relative who has used this College Road surgery for over 60 years. I have contact with the surgery at all levels - receptionists, admin staff, doctors, and the practice manager, and at all times they display a professional and very caring attitude. Nothing is too much trouble for them to deal with. My relative was very proud and grateful to have 2 doses of the Pfizer vaccine earlier this year, and was treated so sympathetically when she arrived. I order medications online every month, which is an efficient and time saving system. I have also found that telephone and video consultations worked well during the pandemic. If I have any health concerns about my elderly relative, I know I can contact College Road Surgery for health advice and support.

title: Please, HOW do I contact you.
body:
Further to my previous review, and your response asking me to contact the surgery, would you please advise as to HOW I am to contact you. 
I rang at 10.30 this Monday morning and, as before, the only two options are: 1-to cancel and appointment. 6-to order a repeat prescription. Both go through to voicemail! It is not POSSIBLE to speak to someone?

title: People you need help from
body: I seem to be the only one who has noticed we are in a Global Pandemic. It is frightening and it has not ended. My care has been exemplarily both by the surgeries and theRoyal Stoke. They go the extra mile always because I like to think I am nice towards them. The Doctors are kind and caring, The Practice Manager is always there for me if I have a problem. That's what she is there for. The other girls I have known for years. We need these people to make sure we live! I Can't fault them I understand how much pressure they are under with jabs. We just have to be more tolerant under this is under control.

title: Rude staff
body: The receptionists are very unwelcoming and dismissive. I was met with a rude and demeaning tone with simple enquiries as-well as witness the same with two previous visitors that were ahead of myself.

title: Amazing Practice!
body: 0 Waiting Time,amazing staff and a very professional service. I wanted to register with a new GP,as I recently moved and went to them. Absolutely Brilliant!

author: Gibbie
title: pre outpatient appointment Covid questionnaire to obtain e pass
body:
Deeply frustrating trying to access site to complete Covid questionnaire day before outpatient appointment for NHS Tayside. Have had couple of appointments recently and clinics sent information letter advising me to complete Covid questionnaire to obtain e pass for my appointment. Website not patient friendly full stop and have had numerous attempts to access questionnaire for my appointments and been unsuccessful for recent two outpatient appointments and one for tomorrow. Struggle to navigate through site. Information on letter received stated website to access and each time unsuccessful which frustrates me more.  
Why set up systems which appear to have no patient consultation prior to programme design to make sure it is easy to follow and firstly able to access site. Sadly another system that I feel has failed to meet patient needs.

author: disinfectantej58
title: What an amazing service
body:
My husband is disabled so am I I’m poor health, we requested an Hеp с test and the hospital arranged for the mobile van to come up to give us both a fingerprick test at our homes, which was so helpful, as it is hard to get blood out of us both (regular blood test) and it is hard for us to get to the hospital at Basingstoke, we don't drive. The van turned up and the two people (Sean and Clive) were very friendly and very professional I was very impressed, especially that results come back so fast  
The information they had about modem treatment for Hep C (as previously interferon treatment, which I went through, was not pleasant), sounded much better and it was nice to be given this information  
Overall we were both very happy to be able to access this service, it was much easier for us to have the van come to us than to go to the hospital The guys on the van were both very knowledgeable and easy to talk to, We would thoroughly recommend this service and hope that it continues as it is invaluable for people such as ourselves who find it hard to attend hospital or for people who drop through the cracks in society and find it difficult to utilise healthcare for themselves. I would like to thank everyone involved

title: Receptionist is very unfriendly
body: Receptionist lady who answered my call on 05.07.21 at the morning time was very cold, she would't allow me to talk, wouldn't listen and it felt to me that person like this should not work at the place where there are unwell people. She needs compassion for this type of the job. She had no enthusiasm or compassion and sounded like she unfortunately doesn't want to deal with people and therefore I think she needs to be reminded NHS values and that little bit of kidness is needed at this job.

title: Dreadful
body: Trying my best to book an oxygen supply.  Received a call last week to confirm, but nothing in writing received.  Called today but the email I received only confirmed that I’d given them my email address, nothing about the booking.  So called again, this time informed there was no booking and I’d never used their service, this is incorrect as I’ve used twice last year.  Total sham.  So I have a holiday booked for this week and no idea if I have an oxygen supply coming.  Total sham.

title: Doctors Surgery
body: My blood test results were explained fully with the reasons why I needed them. My tablets were reviewed by the doctor who advised me to take one of them at a different time to get full benefit. I felt that any issues I had were listened to.

title: Extremely Frustrating Trying to Get an Appointment
body: Have been on the phone waiting over an hours (67 minutes to be exact), slowly listening to my number go down. Was at number 1 for 5 minutes and then here a message to say they are extremely busy with call volumes and therefore can't take my call and I should hang up and call back later! I hear this message after wasting 67 minutes on the phone trying to get an appointment as my GP has referred me! No wonder so many people aren't getting the treatment they need at the moment if they can't even get to speak to someone to book an appointment in the first place.

title: Not the practice but the advice
body:
Called the surgery at 8am but wasn’t allowed to book a face to face appointment (sudden hearing loss). 

Nurse called me back and told me I needed someone to look in my ear initially, and it’d be quicker to go to specsavers than getting an appointment with a HCA. I wasn’t happy with this and explained last time I had this I needed penicillin, and was reluctantly given an appointment at a surgery 30 mins away later in the day.

I called specsavers as a matter of interest and they apologised most sincerely stating they don’t provide GP services and all they could offer was a hearing test. They said they didn’t know why GP surgeries kept sending patients their way. 

Not understanding why a face to face appointment with a GP couldn’t be made initially and then the right diagnosis could be given quickly and accurately instead of all this backwards and forwards and owness on the patient. 

Not happy with this ‘care’

title: Orchard Croft Never Disappoints
body: Both my husband and I are extremely impressed with the swift and excellent service we receive at Orchard Croft. There is a wonderful staff who all work well together, putting our medical  needs first. Thank you for all you do.

title: Rude receptionists
body: First , i was put on hold for no reason.  No explanation.  Secondly,  i didn't  even finish  describing  my son's  symptoms  and was just told to go to the hospital  when actually  all he needed  was a gp review.  This isn't  the  first  time  the receptionists have done this. I did try to make a complaint  to the manager  but it was intercepted  by the receptionist.

title: Terrible
body: Been using this practice for over 15yrs . Still the same issues, with poor front staff. I sometimes prefer to stay sick than call the GP because of the attitude you get. Very condescending. But since the covid, its gotten  worse. You can be on hold for over an hour and that's if the phone rings. Today, my daughter has been Ill and throwing up. I called since 8am and its 11.23am and STILL the numbers engaged. How can a GP service not have a phone system that functions. Now I have to take her to the hospital for something the GP could have probably sorted. Why bother with this review when they refuse to change considering the number of negative reviews written over the years. Seems pointless but I just thought to try.

author: CM143
title: Unwell child
body:
My little boy has been unwell with loose stools for the past week. Unfortunately, mid week, he developed ongoing temperatures and a rash all over his body.  
He was seen by the GP pre temperatures but unfortunately they could not see him again once he developed a temperature and advised we contact NHS 24. I found each interaction with NHS 24 to be helpful and reassuring. We required to have a near me with Dr Burnett due to the ongoing rash and my son's irritability. Dr Burnett was really reassuring and supportive which alleviated our worry regarding my little boy. Thankfully, he has improved and is better.  
Thank you NHS 24,in particular Dr Burnett, its a difficult and stressful time for all but we felt well supported and reassured by your care and attention to detail.

readBy.name: Office of Alexander Burnett, MSP for Aberdeenshire West

author: Racyp85
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My adult son took his own life overseas
body:
My adult son took his own life overseas, and I was struggling with my shock, grief, loss and processing his death.  
My GP gave me the number for Greater Manchester Bereavement Service, where I was listened to, and given the time and space to express my sorrow, a place to cry and a safe place to express my deepest feelings. I had regular calls that took much of the stress away, as we have our own health issues that were impacting on everyday life and not giving me the room to grieve, especially in lockdown. I was feeling alone, isolated and unhappy. It was good to have the continuity of talking to the same person every time about all the multi-faceted problems in my life. I was given a variety of places to contact for emotional and practical support, but it was a little overwhelming on top of the grief and other personal issues to be able to proceed. Some of the agencies I did call were unhelpful, and this just stopped me calling any more. The lady at GMBS intervened and called some organisations for me and that is when the ball started rolling. I now have help emotionally, medically and practically. GMBS has been a life line for me over the past few months.

author: Gross86
title: They were all fantastic!
body: My (almost) 2 year old daughter had been unwell and started to struggle with her breathing on a Saturday lunchtime. I called NHS 24 who sent an ambulance. The paramedics Kirsty and Danny arrived and were absolutely amazing! They checked her over and gave her the treatment she needed while also chatting away to my son who was so excited to see them. They took us to the Royal Hospital for Children in Glasgow and waited with us until we were met by a nurse. We spent 2 nights in Ward 2c and now she is back home and back to her usual self. Every single member of staff we met was absolutely amazing. Doctors, nurses, the cleaner and the man who brought her lunch to her, they were all fantastic! I couldn’t have asked for better treatment for my little girl. Her nurse Leanne in Ward 2c was absolutely wonderful and did an amazing job. She was so lucky to have her as a nurse and I’m in awe of how well she does such a demanding job.

author: MaryL30
title: Going to Robin House
body:
My Daughter has a very rare disorder. She requires 24hr care. Last November she went through spinal surgery. At present, due to COVID, respite care is very restricted. CHAS (Childrens Hospices Association Scotland) have been there for us.  
They have allowed my daughter to go to Robin House for a few days, every few months. It has allowed her to access proper bathing facilities, which we still haven't got at home. Also it has given her Dad and I a chance to get some proper rest and spend time with her sister, which has been beneficial for the whole family.

title: Excellent
body: I have been a patient here for a many many years. Even with the pandemic they have still been an amazingly supportive surgery and have helped me very much. It is the NHS's Birthday today and it is nearly as old as me, so I want to say thank you to my surgery!

title: Costumer service really bad
body:
Takes forever to get an appointment, which is normal with NHS GPs.

After having an appointment and agreed to do some tests, I always have to call back to the practice to remember them to schedule the tests, otherwise, no tests will be scheduled. Same for results. This happens every time. Amazing.

title: Great practice, helpful staff
body: Any time I have phoned to request help, ask just a question or book an appointment, the staff have gone above and beyond to assist me. They may have had 19 calls before mine but sound as cheerful on my call as they did on their first call. I have spoken to different staff and found them all wonderful. Thanks to you all for providing such an excellent service

title: Superb x ray department
body: This morning I attended the x ray department at Erith Hospital. This was for a pre-booked appointment and I found my whole experience was really good, from start to finish. Firstly, the receptionist was very friendly and efficient, next I was seen on time and finally the member of staff who carried out the x rays, could not be faulted. They clearly explained each step of the procedure and were very considerate, making sure that I was comfortable.

title: Wonderful care
body: I was a patient on Ward18 at Redditch hospital recently. The care I received was wonderful and all the staff were so kind. Thank you.

title: Excellent Practice and Care
body: During both appointments I felt comfortable and well looked after.  All staff explained what was happening and made sure I understood and was at ease.

title: Very impressive and thorough care
body: I use the haematology quite frequently and the service is always excellent, especially when considering the extra pressure that the department must be under at the moment. I only go in for a blood test and then the Oncologist phones me for a consultation and that is so reassuring and helpful. I'm very grateful and just wanted to make that known publicly.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Great practice
body: Very lovely and very calm And understanding and helpful and very good at their job and look after me very well to

title: What the others said...
body:
The phone system is an omnishambles! Unless you're among the very lucky, expect to spend and hour or two where you're not even in the queue, because the queue can only handle so many - when you finally get through to the queue, expect to wait for ages listening to utterly boring music interrupted by a notice that you will know by heart when you finally get through as well as your position in the queue.
When you finally get through, it's generally a great place, especially if you present physical symptoms - the doctors will follow up with calls, where the practice calls YOU to agree on a time that would suit you.
If you present mental health symptoms, they'll give you a prescription and ask you to book an appointment with the counsellor, who will suggest that you follow a course in town every Monday around midday. Sorry, but I'm working, so the only way I can follow a course like that is to wait until I get so sick that I can't work.

title: Absolutely wonderful
body:
What fantastic treatment!  Had a mastectomy and treatment has been superb. Staff are just wonderful, respectful, friendly and hard working. 
Pleased with communications and in fact all the treatment so far.

readBy.name: Wirral University Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: First Class service
body: The Roumainian nurse was first class , I was seen very quickly and the young lady Doctor who dealt with me was of the highest standard , so knowledgeable and helpful , empathetic and bags of personality , she had time to listen and explain, I am very impressed and proud of our NHS . From the reception onwards everything was professional , the Doctor was an absolute credit . I'm sure she will go far.

title: Incredibly rude reception staff
body:
Reception staff are the first people you come into contact with and it’s important they are compassionate and caring.
Unfortunately the staff here are extremely rude. Whilst sat in the waiting room I have heard them laughing at peoples problems and gossiping about others.
It’s obviously unprofessional and probably breaking some sort of code of conduct.
The staff here have to put up with a lot of issues, however it is hard to justify their rudeness and general demeanour when talking to and about patients

title: Can't get through!
body: Onto my second week of trying to get an appointment. On the rare as hens teeth occasion that someone does answer you are told 'no appointments ring another day'. Its either engaged or you're forced to listen to infernal dreadful music with someone bleating every so often "your call is very important to us"..can't be that important as no one answers!! Shocking service and I'm sure that by the time I'm able to get an appointment I'll have died of old age!

title: Bad customer service
body: From the moment you need to get hold of them,they never answer, let me delayed by 3 months,and after all of that,they can't make my surgery, very disappointed

title: Service was already terrible but now it’s even…
body: You simply cannot get through for an urgent appointment. I was instructed by my hospital consultant to get an urgent GP appointment and despite saying this the first appointment I was offered was 3 days later. I rang the surgery to enquire and was still told that they do not do any urgent GP telephone calls anymore. So instead I went to hospital to block their services for a day for advice and a prescription, who told me I should have been seen urgently by my GP! You just can’t make this stuff up - I have no idea why receptionists are now permitted to triage patients with no qualifications!

title: Covid 2nd Vaccination Limbo (Part 2)
body: After leaving 1st review on the above matter I was advised to contact the surgery where they would look into it. I detailed the problems I was having once again ie trying to book online or over the phone (but not being able to as my details weren't updated properly the first time) my second vaccine despite being supposedly on the priority list and it being weeks now over the 12 week guideline for the second dose. I got another short and sweet  reply saying -  you need to book online or phone 119! Wow.. thanks for that. I now have officially given up trying to get the second vaccine and just hope I don't infect anyone more vulnerable than me in the coming weeks or months!

title: Fantastic service
body: I struggled initially to get an appointment slot, and found the online service quite counterintuitive to use, but the actual service at the centre was great. I had a contraceptive coil removed and a new one inserted. I was quite apprehensive about the procedure, as last time I had the same thing done (at a different GP practice), it was extremely painful. The staff at the Hathersage Centre made me feel very comfortable, and did a great job - it was still uncomfortable, but not anywhere near as bad as I was anticipating.

title: Disappointing every time
body: I am so disappointed. I’ve tried desperately not to bother the drs throughout Covid & lockdown.  When I ring for an appointment… which I try really hard not to do because it’s just so difficult, I either cannot get through or I’m told to ring again tomorrow for an appointment. This is simply not good enough when you have an infection that needs antibiotics that day… not another day of waiting. It causes patients unnecessary stress, anxiety and discomfort.  Ringing first thing in the morning is terribly difficult and requires more time off work and still does not guarantee you will be seen. Plus it takes all morning to get through and by then the appointments have gone. I am a teacher, taking time off is very difficult and stressful. Today, I have just been told I cannot even have a telephone consultation, as there is no availability and to attend an acute walk in centre in Corby or ring back tomorrow. What if I can’t get to Corby?! What if I’m too unwell to get to Corby?!  Does this happen to elderly patients or people without transport. It’s just so sad and uncaring. I feel sorry for the ladies on reception and this is not a complaint to anyone personally. But it really is dreadful service and completely unacceptable. Lastly, a review of my repeat prescription was completely missed. I rang to chase it up and get a blood test sorted but I was rudely told to wait to be contacted by them. I waited.  Four months later, I had still not heard anything, so I’ve left a message on my app. Thankfully, I have now had a blood test but again, terrible service. I hardly dare bother the Drs by ringing for the results.

title: How do you get in touch???
body: I have been awaiting medical forms for a job to be completed for 2 months first 2 sets of forms lost third set I have been trying to contact for 2 weeks not even able to be placed in a que due to high call volumes and when placed in a que waiting on hold for up to 2 hours before having to hang up! The one time I did get through after an hour and 45 minutes I was told the person I needed to speak to was not in and assured I would receive a phone call the following day 5 days later I am still waiting and multiple calls and hours waisted have still not been able to get through! Terrible practice

title: Extremely unprofessional behaviour
body: The receptionists are very rude and look down upon patients. Appointments are never available and they would tell you to call later on and then would make you wait for hours and afterwards tell you again that appointments are not available.

title: Awful
body: The doctor was so rude and didn’t had any respect I’m 19 he was talking very rudely he was unsure for the treatment didn’t do anything. If I had pain that’s why I went there who likes going to doctor without any reason. Honestly very disrespectful

title: Terrible service from the reception staff
body: Very unprofessional reception staff, give you the wrong dates for appointments,they don't call you to inform you that your appointment has been cancelled. I definitely don't recommend this place.

title: Receptionists giving out advice / prescribing…
body: The receptionists locally are known for being exceptionally unhelpful and rude but today the lady I spoke to went above and beyond with her rudeness.  Not only was I refused an appointment to see a doctor she also suggested the medication I should be getting from the chemist and taking - not seeing the issues / knowing any of my family history / my allergies etc.   Receptionists are not qualified to administer or dispense medication - they should not be telling patients what to take. They are not allowed to give out their names, so you cannot escalate a complaint, probably because they have had so many!

title: Shocking service totally unacceptable
body:
I have cystic fibrosis and I have to use lloyd clinical homecare for my kaftrio as they are the only company allowed to dispense this medication.
I have now been left with no medication and am left ringing them hours a day and still I get no answer. 
As I now have no medication my health is now starting to decline.
I have spent over 8 hours on hold trying to get to speak to someone I have emailed them with no replies.
This company should have there license revoked as they are not fit for purpose

title: Unusual bad influence every time
body: Mulgrave road surgery will be ok when the lady on the phone ( receptionist) will be change to another . Every every time she is not in a mood… with bad influence. This is not only my point of view… Please , someone to speak with her or to raise her salary so she can be more kind to us ;(

title: hard to contact
body: care seems good, but under an hour on the phone to get through is rare, you can't book a nurse on line, and, when they need to cancel an appointent, as seems frequent,they don't ring for long as there has been nothing on the answering machine and i have three times turned up to be told of cancellation; this really is unacceptable even at times of pressure. but there seems to be no alternative locally as they run all the surgeries round here.

title: Never phoned me back
body:
I’m so disappointed. I’ve emailed the surgery three times last week, spent in total over one hour on the phone waiting to talk to someone but nobody answered the phone and I’ve been ignored despite two e-consultation forms submitted. 

This is incredibly frustrating as at least they should answer the phone/reply to messages. 

I don’t understand how NHS can accept this.

title: This is not a great practice
body:
I just transferred to this practice a couple of months ago and I am not happy with their services. Here are my reasons: 1). Some of the receptionists are rude and in a rush to speak to or answer my questions about appointment bookings (especially on the telephone)  2). I requested to have access of my medical records and test results online but receptionist said I am not allowed (my previous GP allowed me to have access).  Patients should have the right to access their own medical records.  3). One of the nurses and a few doctors does not seem to know what they are doing or talking about or maybe they are in a rush to even bother to establish good patient care and answer patient concerns and questions properly. I didn't have this issue with my previous practice, the doctor there was very kind, open and knowledgeable. 4).  Since I don't feel comfortable with some of the doctors and nurses in the practice, I don't seem to have a freedom of choice to choose which doctor or nurse I want to have an appointment with. 5).  The practice (especially some of the doctors I have encountered) doesn't seem to acknowledge mental health issues. I have mentioned I have anxiety a few times (that could be related to my symptoms) but none of them suggested any form of therapy. I have to find out about talking therapies myself. 6). You cannot book appointments online or on their app even if their website says so. You have to call them at 8am and queue for 20 to 30 minutes. 7).  They sometimes make you stand and wait outside to be let in for face to face appointment.  They should have a system for this or let the patients know what exact time they can check in so that elderly, vulnerable, people with disabilities and pregnant women doesn't have to stand and wait outside for long. The area outside to wait is small that sometimes it gets crowded with people coming in and out the same entrance and there is not enough space for social distancing. They don't have a one way system for COVID precaution unlike other surgeries.

The only 2 good things about this practice are: 1). The midwife team is really good, caring and understanding. 2). The location is good, there is a good parking space and the practice building, rooms and sitting area are spacious and clean.

title: Archaic systems
body: Difficult to get appointments on the day, why you cant book them in advance I do not know. My previous surgery did this easy enough. Not grasping the digital age with information that can be uploaded on to our individual accounts. Full medical history etc. Would be nice when visiting outpatients and sending info to other consultants.

title: Exemplorary Emergency Care from the Resus Team
body:
I owe my life to the above team to whom I have no memory. Their dedication and extraordinary expertise saved my life. I owe the wonderful resus team a huge debt of gratitude not only for their emergency treatment but for communicating  at regular intervals with my husband. I was admitted via an ambulance at approximately 6.30 AM on 6th January and have no recollection of events until I awoke hours later in Intensive Care. To each and every member of staff that responded to my medical needs so swiftly, efficiently and with such professional skill and competence - saying thank you sounds rather hollow. At a human level my natural instinct is to give each of you a big hug: [ being 75 years old I think I could get away with that]. You are faceless individuals to me and yet I feel a deep personal connection with you- Your compassion and whatever words you expressed to me on that remarkable day in my life has made its mark in my heart. 
May the warmth of this message from myself and my adoring family help to sustain you in all the medical emergencies you face.
Yours affectionately 
Joan Wellington [Joannie]

title: Great practice
body:
All reception staff are friendly, professional, patient and knowledgeable. 

All doctors and nurses are approachable and thorough. They use their listening skills to understand the problem enabling them to make an informed decision going forward. Referrals are always very prompt. 
It’s brilliant also that so many additional services are offered at the practice eg blood tests, ultrasounds, skin biopsies 

The facilities are super clean and social distance systems are excellent. I always feel safe and protected. 

Obviously the practice is under pressure since the pandemic but the staff and systems in place make getting an appointment relatively easy. 
I think the telephone consultation is brilliant. This determines whether you need a face to face appointment. Pre pandemic I think perhaps time was wasted actually seeing a physician when a telephone consultation could have saved time for both patient and GP. 

This is the third practice I have belonged to in Luton and Larkside is more than head and shoulders above. 

You all do a fantastic job and offer a brilliant service. 

I have no hesitation in recommending Larkside.

title: Eye care
body: I felt the staff were so professional, helpful and kind. I highly recommend Evolution . Everything was explained to me on layman terms that I understood. They also answered my questions and put my mind at rest

title: Wonderful Staff on DVT clinic
body: Just a quick thank you for your patience today when I brought my husband into the DVT clinic.  You were so kind an reassuring with him, even waiting with him whilst I went for the car, as it was too far for him to walk.  Thank you once again

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Horrible treatment
body: I arrived in the room and it felt like I was disturbing something. It felt very rushed, even when she reclined the chair I wasn’t warned and it was done very quickly which added to my unease. The main lady that attended to me didn’t use a light to properly look in my mouth to assess the cyst. She said she couldn’t see it but I knew this wasn’t true as I’d seen in earlier that day. And I’ve taken pictures to prove it. I don’t feel safe being attended to by the same doctor in the future as I’m already worried about the cyst and the fact that she didn’t take it seriously only made me feel worse
